summary: Anne B Misita is identified as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Her name appears in multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to February 1979. These documents detail the committee's staff, their positions, and salaries during the HSCA's investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific role of Anne B Misita within the committee is not explicitly stated in the provided summaries, her presence on these payroll documents indicates her involvement in the committee's operations during this period.
significance: Anne B Misita's significance lies in her being a staff member of the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination. Her presence in payroll and certification reports provides a record of the personnel involved in the committee's work.
